data.caption: Corporate Action-Board approves Dividend
data.news_body: In compliance with Regulation 42 of SEBI (LODR) Regulations 2015 and other applicable provision if any this is to inform you that the Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held today i.e. Friday February 06 2026 has inter alia considered and approved Declaration of 1st Interim Dividend @ 200% on face value i.e. Interim Dividend amount of Rs. 2.00/- per equity share of Face Value of Rs. 1/- each on 411740908 equity shares of the Company for the Financial Year 2025-26. Further the company has decided to consider the name of Beneficial owners as recorded at the end of business hours as on  February 13 2026 (Record Date) as per the list to be furnished by NSDL and CDSL in respect of shares held in Dematerialized form and Members in the Register of Members of the Company in respect of shares held in Physical Form for the purpose of reckoning the list of shareholders entitled to receive the Interim dividend.

This is to inform you that in accordance with Companys Code of Conduct and SEBI (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations 2015 (including any statutory modification(s) amendment(s) and re-enactment(s) thereof for the time being in force) the Trading Window for trading in the securities of the Company will be closed for the Designated persons and immediate relatives of the Designated persons with effect from Thursday January 01 2026 till completion of 48 hours after the Un-audited financial results of the Company for the third quarter and nine months ended on December 31 2025 is generally made available to the public.

data.caption: Update- HonBle High Court Of Delhi Sets Aside The Debarment Imposed By The Ministry Of External Affairs (MEA) Government Of India
data.news_body:
Dear Sir / Madam

Pursuant to Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations 2015 (SEBI LODR Regulations) and in continuation of the Companys earlier intimation dated October 11 2025 regarding the order passed by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) imposing a Debarment on BLS International Services Limited (the Company) from participation in future tenders of the MEA and India Mission abroad for period of two (2) years we wish to inform you of the following development:

The Company had challenged the aforesaid debarment order by filing a writ petition before the Honble High Court of Delhi. The Company has received an order from the Honble High Court of Delhi setting aside the debarment order passed by the MEA. Consequently the debarment imposed on the Company pursuant to the said order stands quashed.

Outcome Of Meeting Of Nomination And Remuneration Committee Held On November 11
2025
data.news_body:
Pursuant to provisions of Regulation 30 of Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and
Disclosure Requirements) Regulations 2015 (the Listing Regulations) and applicable provisions of the
Securities and Exchange Board of India (Share Based Employee Benefits and Sweat Equity) Regulations
2021 we hereby inform you that Nomination and Remuneration Committee (NRC) of the Company in its
Meeting held today i.e. Tuesday November 11 2025 has approved the grant of 78000 Employees Stock
Options (Options) convertible into equal number of equity shares of the Company of face value of Re.1/-
each to the eligible employee of the Company under the BLS International Employees Stock Option
Scheme 2023.
The information in terms of Regulation 30 of the Listing Regulations read with circular no.
SEBI/HO/CFD/PoD2/CIR/P/0155 dated November 11 2024 issued by the Securities and Exchange Board of
India is enclosed herewith as Annexure - A.

data.caption: Reg. 34 (1) Annual Report.
data.news_body: This is in furtherance to our earlier submission on revised Annual report for F.Y. 2024-25 dated September 10 2025 we would like to inform your good office that page numbering typo error was noticed in the Management Discussion and Analysis Report section of the Annual Report. Specifically after page no. 80 the subsequent page was incorrectly numbered as 87 instead of 81. As a result of this error the following pages of the Annual Report were incorrectly numbered. This typographical printing error has been rectified in the enclosed revised version of the Annual Report for F.Y. 2024-25. Pursuant to this change all previous changes done in the referred announcement dated September 10 2025 shall be read with new page numbering as enclosed in the Annexure -1.

data.caption: Reg. 34 (1) Annual Report.
data.news_body:
Dear Sir/Maam

This is in furtherance to our earlier corporate announcement dated August 21 2025 wherein the Company had submitted its Annual Report for F.Y. 2024-25.

We would like to inform your good office that certain inadvertent typographical errors were noticed in the Annual Report for F.Y. 2024-25 as mentioned in Annexure -1. 

In view of the above we are enclosing herewith the revised Annual Report of the Company for the FY 2024-25. The revised report shall also be made available on the website of the Company at www.blsinternational.com

data.caption: Board Meeting Outcome for Outcome Of Board Of Directors Meeting Held On Wednesday, August 09, 2023
data.news_body:
In compliance with Reg 30 and 33 of the SEBI LODR, Board at their meeting held 09.08.2023, has, inter alia, considered and approved following items of agenda:
1. Standalone and Consolidated Un-audited Financial Results for the first quarter ended June 30, 2023.

4. The Board has also approved the 'BLS International Employees Stock Option Scheme- 2023' to be implemented through Trust Route
5. The Board has also approved the relevant revision in the following policies:
a. Code of Internal Procedures and Conduct for Regulating, Monitoring and Reporting of Trading
by Designated Persons and its Immediate Relatives.
b. Policy on determination and disclosure of materiality of events
c. Nomination and Remuneration Policy
